content:
BindingsCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of Binding objects for a control.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("CollectionChanged")]
public class BindingsCollection : System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • MarshalByRefObject
  • System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection
  • BindingsCollection

Inherited Members

CreateObjRef(Type)
,
GetLifetimeService()
,
InitializeLifetimeService()
,
MemberwiseClone(Boolean)
,
Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()
,
CopyTo(Array,Int32)
,
GetEnumerator()
,
IsReadOnly
,
IsSynchronized
,
SyncRoot

Remarks

Simple data binding is accomplished by adding Binding objects to a BindingsCollection. Any object that inherits from the Control class can access the BindingsCollection through the DataBindings property. For a list of Windows controls that support data binding, see the Binding class.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the total number of bindings in the collection.
Item(Int32)

Gets the Binding at the specified index.
List

Gets the bindings in the collection as an object.

Methods summary

Add(Binding)

Adds the specified binding to the collection.
AddCore(Binding)

Adds a Binding to the collection.
Clear()

Clears the collection of binding objects.
ClearCore()

Clears the collection of any members.
OnCollectionChanged(CollectionChangeEventArgs)

Raises the CollectionChanged event.
OnCollectionChanging(CollectionChangeEventArgs)

Raises the CollectionChanging event.
Remove(Binding)

Deletes the specified binding from the collection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Deletes the binding from the collection at the specified index.
RemoveCore(Binding)

Removes the specified Binding from the collection.
ShouldSerializeMyAll()

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection should be serialized.

Events summary

CollectionChanged

Occurs when the collection has changed.
CollectionChanging

Occurs when the collection is about to change.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the total number of bindings in the collection.

    public override int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The total number of bindings in the collection.

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets the Binding at the specified index.

    public System.Windows.Forms.Binding this[int index] { get; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the Binding to find.

    Property Value

    • Binding

      The Binding at the specified index.

    Exceptions

    • IndexOutOfRangeException

      The collection doesn't contain an item at the specified index.

    Example

    The following example prints the BindingMember value of each Binding in a control's BindingsCollection. 

       void PrintBindingInfo()
   {
      BindingsCollection^ bc = text1->DataBindings;
      for ( int i = 0; i < bc->Count; i++ )
         Console::WriteLine( bc[ i ]->BindingMemberInfo.BindingMember );
   }

    private void PrintBindingInfo()
{
   BindingsCollection bc = text1.DataBindings;
   for(int i = 0; i < bc.Count; i++)
      Console.WriteLine(bc[i].BindingMemberInfo.BindingMember);
}

    Private Sub PrintBindingInfo()
   Dim bc As BindingsCollection = Text1.DataBindings
   Dim i As Integer 
   For i = 0 to bc.Count - 1
      Console.WriteLine(bc(i).BindingMemberInfo.BindingMember)
   Next i
End Sub
  • List

    Gets the bindings in the collection as an object.

    protected override System.Collections.ArrayList List { get; }

    Property Value

    • ArrayList

      An ArrayList containing all of the collection members.

Methods

  • Add(Binding)

    Adds the specified binding to the collection.

    protected void Add (System.Windows.Forms.Binding binding);

    Parameters

    • binding
      Binding

      The Binding to add to the collection.

  • AddCore(Binding)

    Adds a Binding to the collection.

    protected virtual void AddCore (System.Windows.Forms.Binding dataBinding);

    Parameters

    • dataBinding
      Binding

      The Binding to add to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The dataBinding argument was null.

    Example

    
 Private Sub BindControl()
    Dim ds As DataSet
    ' Not shown: code to populate DataSet with tables.
    Text1.DataBindings.Add("Text", ds.Tables("Products"), "ProductName")
    Label1.DataBindings.Add("Text", ds.Tables("Suppliers"), "CompanyName")
    
 End Sub
  • Clear()

    Clears the collection of binding objects.

    protected void Clear ();

    Remarks

    The CollectionChanged event occurs when you invoke the Clear method.

  • ClearCore()

    Clears the collection of any members.

    protected virtual void ClearCore ();
  • OnCollectionChanged(CollectionChangeEventArgs)

    Raises the CollectionChanged event.

    protected virtual void OnCollectionChanged (System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs ccevent);

    Parameters

    • ccevent
      CollectionChangeEventArgs

      A CollectionChangeEventArgs that contains the event data.

    Remarks

    Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

    The OnCollectionChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

  • OnCollectionChanging(CollectionChangeEventArgs)

    Raises the CollectionChanging event.

    protected virtual void OnCollectionChanging (System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      CollectionChangeEventArgs

      A CollectionChangeEventArgs that contains event data.

    Remarks

    The CollectionChanging event occurs when the event is about to change.

    Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

    The OnCollectionChanging method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

  • Remove(Binding)

    Deletes the specified binding from the collection.

    protected void Remove (System.Windows.Forms.Binding binding);

    Parameters

    • binding
      Binding

      The Binding to remove from the collection.

  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Deletes the binding from the collection at the specified index.

    protected void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the Binding to remove.

  • RemoveCore(Binding)

    Removes the specified Binding from the collection.

    protected virtual void RemoveCore (System.Windows.Forms.Binding dataBinding);

    Parameters

    • dataBinding
      Binding

      The Binding to remove.

  • ShouldSerializeMyAll()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the collection should be serialized.

    protected bool ShouldSerializeMyAll ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the collection count is greater than zero; otherwise, false.

Events

  • CollectionChanged

    Occurs when the collection has changed.

    public event System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventHandler CollectionChanged;

    Remarks

    For more information about handling events, see Events.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the CollectionChanged event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing Show with WriteLine or appending the message to a multiline TextBox.

    To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type BindingsCollection named BindingsCollection1. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the CollectionChanged event. 

    private void BindingsCollection1_CollectionChanged(Object sender, CollectionChangeEventArgs e) {

System.Text.StringBuilder messageBoxCS = new System.Text.StringBuilder();
messageBoxCS.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "Action", e.Action );
messageBoxCS.AppendLine();
messageBoxCS.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "Element", e.Element );
messageBoxCS.AppendLine();
MessageBox.Show(messageBoxCS.ToString(), "CollectionChanged Event" );
}

    Private Sub BindingsCollection1_CollectionChanged(sender as Object, e as CollectionChangeEventArgs) _ 
     Handles BindingsCollection1.CollectionChanged

    Dim messageBoxVB as New System.Text.StringBuilder()
    messageBoxVB.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "Action", e.Action)
    messageBoxVB.AppendLine()
    messageBoxVB.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "Element", e.Element)
    messageBoxVB.AppendLine()
    MessageBox.Show(messageBoxVB.ToString(),"CollectionChanged Event")

End Sub
  • CollectionChanging

    Occurs when the collection is about to change.

    public event System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventHandler CollectionChanging;

    Remarks

    For more information about handling events, see Events.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the CollectionChanging event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing Show with WriteLine or appending the message to a multiline TextBox.

    To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type BindingsCollection named BindingsCollection1. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the CollectionChanging event. 

    private void BindingsCollection1_CollectionChanging(Object sender, CollectionChangeEventArgs e) {

System.Text.StringBuilder messageBoxCS = new System.Text.StringBuilder();
messageBoxCS.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "Action", e.Action );
messageBoxCS.AppendLine();
messageBoxCS.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "Element", e.Element );
messageBoxCS.AppendLine();
MessageBox.Show(messageBoxCS.ToString(), "CollectionChanging Event" );
}

    Private Sub BindingsCollection1_CollectionChanging(sender as Object, e as CollectionChangeEventArgs) _ 
     Handles BindingsCollection1.CollectionChanging

    Dim messageBoxVB as New System.Text.StringBuilder()
    messageBoxVB.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "Action", e.Action)
    messageBoxVB.AppendLine()
    messageBoxVB.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "Element", e.Element)
    messageBoxVB.AppendLine()
    MessageBox.Show(messageBoxVB.ToString(),"CollectionChanging Event")

End Sub
